reviews.review_msg: I don't get these bad reviews cuz aJay is an absolute sweetheart. This man not only cares about your success in the course, but also about you as an individual. His discussions may sometimes be irrelevant to class material, yet still fun to just listen to. If you show good effort in class/tut, he'll definitely cut you some slack in grading.
He is my favourite TA ever! Made coming to tutorials so fun and interesting! He's great at playing the ukulele and all his ukulele covers are spectacular. Great at keeping students engaged.

I could not stand coming to class. Every single class was just him rambling on and making zero sense. i am really disappointed because I thought this course would be super interesting but I learned nothing. Half the course was just him talking about his music. He is a nice guy but should not be teaching this course.
He talked way too much about music for an education class. You really don't need to go to his lectures for this class. No exams and all assignments are based on readings or documentaries.
really don't think he was suited to teach this class to be honest. seems very distracted and unfocused in what exactly he is teaching.
if all ur students are leaving ur lectures after like 5 minutes, maybe change the way ur lecturing instead of forcing us to stay by implementing an attendance sheet like we're children...
Ajay seems like a nice person, but he is a horrible professor for education. I think he should teach music classes instead.

literally is the worst education class I've ever taken. haven't learned anything during his lectures as all he does is go on multiple tangents on topics completely unrelated to the course. going to the lectures is honestly a joke and if it wasn't for the attendance sheet, you would never find me willingly going to class.

Goes way off topic every week, creates/changes the course as he goes, did nothing then saved everything until the end, makes extremely random discussion posts, takes attendance so your forced to go to this useless class...

literally only talks about music. hasnt taught me anything about the "social issues of education". has no idea how the public school system in BC even works ... spends so much of class time playing random songs and videos

Nice guy but doesn't actually teach anything related to the course. I signed up for social issues in education but it seems like I'm in a music class. Goes way off topic every class. People only show up to lecture for attendance; once people write their names down on the attendance sheet they leave. His class sucks!! Very boring also!!

The course turned from social issues in education to youtube videos of him working out and going on tangents about things unrelated to the course content. Lectures are mainly unrelated to assignments. Forces students to participate in class but cuts people off before they finish talking. The only thing keeping me in this course is my TA.

goes on long unrelated tangents about music, spends class time playing random videos, hardly speaks on social issues of education (what the course is about), changes the course entirely as he goes with little notice, clearly just loves to hear himself, makes us watch videos of him exercising. definitely not qualified to be teaching this course
